Even governments die. sf
 



-----Original Message-----
From: adrianamjone=
s <adrianamjones@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Fri, Oc=
t 1, 2010 4:40 am
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Government Conspiracy... I Think Not

=
          =C2=A0                                  So last Saturday I had my=
 first ghost box session with an experienced box user who also claims to be=
 an empath medium.  It was successful, in that there were too many intellig=
ent responses from the radio for it to be "a coincidence".  Despite this, t=
here are some people I've talked to about this who, even after having heard=
 the recording of the session, still want to hold on to an old way of think=
ing at any cost to logic and reality.  Just because it is too amazing to be=
 true, doesn't ALWAYS mean that it is.  For those of us that have experienc=
ed the paranormal in our life, we know that not all things in life are too =
incredible to be true.  But for others, it is harder to accept...
 Tonight =
I hacked my first ghost box, a Radio Shack 20-125, it was an easy hack desp=
ite claims that it is difficult, and the fact that I am completely new to t=
his area of research and know next to nothing about electronics.  I could r=
eally see myself spending a lot of my future life immersed in this, so can =
anyone tell me... what do I say to somebody that wants to claim that ghost =
box communication is a technological government conspiracy akin to the cons=
piracy of using Christianity to brainwashes the masses... (i.e. to keep the=
m believing in the next life, so they can be "raped" and willingly give to =
Caesar in this life).  What is the proof and evidence against this being th=
e case?
 
 
      
                 
   
       
  


----------MB_8CD2FA25F5C71AF_1410_1D531_webmail-m042.sysops.aol.com

<div>So last Saturday I had my first=
 ghost box session with an experienced box user who also claims to be an em=
path medium.  It was successful, in that there were too many intelligent re=
sponses from the radio for it to be "a coincidence".  Despite this, there a=
re some people I've talked to about this who, even after having heard the r=
ecording of the session, still want to hold on to an old way of thinking at=
 any cost to logic and reality.  Just because it is too amazing to be true,=
 doesn't ALWAYS mean that it is.  For those of us that have experienced the=
 paranormal in our life, we know that not all things in life are too incred=
ible to be true.  But for others, it is harder to accept...<br>
 Tonight I =
hacked my first ghost box, a Radio Shack 20-125, it was an easy hack despit=
e claims that it is difficult, and the fact that I am completely new to thi=
s area of research and know next to nothing about electronics.  I could rea=
lly see myself spending a lot of my future life immersed in this, so can an=
yone tell me... what do I say to somebody that wants to claim that ghost bo=
x communication is a technological government conspiracy akin to the conspi=
racy of using Christianity to brainwashes the masses... (i.e. to keep them =
believing in the next life, so they can be "raped" and willingly give to Ca=
esar in this life).  What is the proof and evidence against this being the =
case?<br>
 <br>
 </div>
